subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Montclair High School’s bid to win a New Jersey state football title fell short Saturday with an 18-14 loss to visiting Hackensack in a Section I Group IV semifinal game. Montclair (7-3) entered the game having won four of five since the death of Ryne Dougherty on Oct. 15. Dougherty, a 16-year-old junior linebacker, had a brain hemorrhage while making a tackle during a junior varsity game and died two days later. The Mounties, the top seed, beat fifth-seeded Hackensack (7-3) two weeks ago, 35-13.
